problem.prob_desc:
25. 숫자 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6이 하나씩 적혀 있는 6장의 카드가 있다. 이 6장의 카드를 모두 한 번씩 사용하여 일렬로 임의로 나열할 때, 양 끝에 놓인 카드에 적힌 두 수의 합이 10 이하가 되도록 카드가 놓일 확률은? [3점]
① $\dfrac{8}{15}$ ② $\dfrac{19}{30}$ ③ $\dfrac{11}{15}$ ④ $\dfrac{5}{6}$ ⑤ $\dfrac{14}{15}$

gpt-5-codex.title: Setup probability framework
gpt-5-codex.body: 모든 카드의 배치 가짓수는 6! = 720이다. 양끝 카드의 순서가 정해지면 나머지 네 장의 카드는 4! = 24가지로 배치되므로, 전체 확률 문제는 양끝 두 카드의 순서쌍(총 6×5 = 30개) 중에서 합이 10 이하인 경우의 수를 찾는 문제로 바꿀 수 있다.

gpt-5-codex.title: Count valid end pairs
gpt-5-codex.body: 서로 다른 두 수로 이루어진 순서쌍 (a, b) 중 합이 10을 초과하는 경우는 (5,6)과 (6,5)뿐이다. 전체 30개의 순서쌍 중 2개가 부적합하므로, 합이 10 이하인 순서쌍의 개수는 30 - 2 = 28개이다.

gpt-5-codex.title: Compute probability
gpt-5-codex.body: 유리한 순서쌍이 28개이고 전체 순서쌍이 30개이므로, 확률은 28/30 = 14/15이다. 선택지 중 ⑤에 해당한다.

gpt-5.title: Reduce to end-pair counting
gpt-5.body: In a random permutation of {1,2,3,4,5,6}, the two end cards form a uniformly random ordered pair of distinct numbers (6×5 total). Since the sum condition ignores order, it suffices to count unordered pairs among C(6,2)=15; each unordered pair has probability 1/15 of being the set of ends.

gpt-5.title: Count unfavorable pairs
gpt-5.body: We need sum ≤ 10. The only possible sum > 10 with numbers 1–6 is 11, which occurs only for the pair (5,6). Thus, unfavorable unordered pairs = 1.

gpt-5.title: Compute probability and choose option
gpt-5.body: Favorable unordered pairs = 15 − 1 = 14. Therefore, probability = 14/15, which corresponds to option ⑤.

claude-opus-4.5.title: Identify the problem setup
claude-opus-4.5.body:
We have 6 cards numbered 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6. We arrange all 6 cards in a row and need to find the probability that the sum of the two end cards is 10 or less.

Total arrangements = 6! = 720

claude-opus-4.5.title: Find pairs where sum exceeds 10
claude-opus-4.5.body:
We need to find cases where the sum of end cards is MORE than 10 (i.e., 11 or 12), then subtract from 1.

Possible pairs with sum > 10:
- (5, 6): sum = 11
- (6, 5): sum = 11
- (6, 6): impossible (only one 6)

So only the pair {5, 6} at the ends gives sum > 10.

claude-opus-4.5.title: Count unfavorable arrangements
claude-opus-4.5.body:
When 5 and 6 are at both ends:
- Choose which end gets 5 and which gets 6: 2 ways
- Arrange remaining 4 cards (1, 2, 3, 4) in the middle: 4! = 24 ways

Unfavorable arrangements = 2 × 24 = 48

claude-opus-4.5.title: Calculate probability
claude-opus-4.5.body:
Favorable arrangements = Total - Unfavorable = 720 - 48 = 672

Probability = 672/720 = 672/720

Simplify: 672/720 = 56/60 = 14/15

gemini-3-pro.title: Calculate the total number of relevant outcomes
gemini-3-pro.body: The problem asks for the probability concerning the numbers at the two ends of a row of 6 distinct cards (1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6). The total number of ways to arrange the cards is $6!$. However, since the condition only depends on the two ends, we can consider the sample space as the number of permutations of 2 cards chosen from 6. This is $_6P_2 = 6 	imes 5 = 30$.

gemini-3-pro.title: Identify cases for the complement event
gemini-3-pro.body: We are looking for the probability that the sum of the two end numbers is $\le 10$. It is simpler to count the complement event: the sum is $> 10$. Since the maximum possible sum of two distinct numbers from this set is $5 + 6 = 11$, the only sum greater than 10 is 11. The only pair that allows this is $\{5, 6\}$. Arranging this pair at the ends gives 2 possible outcomes: $(5, 6)$ and $(6, 5)$.

gemini-3-pro.title: Compute the final probability
gemini-3-pro.body: There are 2 outcomes where the sum is greater than 10. The number of favorable outcomes (sum $\le 10$) is the total outcomes minus the complement outcomes: $30 - 2 = 28$. The probability is thus $\frac{28}{30}$. Simplifying the fraction, we get $\frac{14}{15}$.

grok-4-fast.title: Calculate total arrangements
grok-4-fast.body: The total number of ways to arrange 6 distinct cards is 6! = 720. Since the condition depends only on the ends, consider the positions for the ends: there are 6 choices for the left end and 5 for the right end, giving 30 possible ordered pairs for the ends, each equally likely.

grok-4-fast.title: Identify favorable condition
grok-4-fast.body: We need the sum of the numbers on the left and right ends, A and B, to satisfy A + B ≤ 10, where A and B are distinct integers from 1 to 6.

grok-4-fast.title: Find unfavorable pairs
grok-4-fast.body: The only pairs from 1 to 6 that sum to more than 10 are those involving 5 and 6: (5,6) sums to 11 and (6,5) sums to 11. All other ordered pairs sum to 10 or less (e.g., 4+6=10, 6+4=10, 5+4=9≤10).

grok-4-fast.title: Count favorable pairs
grok-4-fast.body: Out of 30 possible ordered pairs, 2 are unfavorable. Thus, there are 28 favorable ordered pairs.

grok-4-fast.title: Compute probability
grok-4-fast.body: The probability is 28/30 = 14/15. For each such pair on the ends, the middle 4 cards can be arranged in 4! ways, but this factor cancels out in the probability.
